body_html:
@henrylee2570 Just like described in #8477, I believe this error occurs for a process killed by mistake due to a SIGCHLD signal. To add time.sleep(), I guess, make this signal handled already, then it would not call a terminal of a useful process.

BUT, this explanation is mainly a guess, if you find it wrong, let me know. THX! However, time.sleep() is indeed useful for avoiding this error referring to my experience.
body_text:
@henrylee2570 Just like described in #8477, I believe this error occurs for a process killed by mistake due to a SIGCHLD signal. To add time.sleep(), I guess, make this signal handled already, then it would not call a terminal of a useful process.
BUT, this explanation is mainly a guess, if you find it wrong, let me know. THX! However, time.sleep() is indeed useful for avoiding this error referring to my experience.
body:
@henrylee2570 Just like described in [#8477](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/8477#issue-332298760), I believe this error occurs for a process killed by mistake due to a SIGCHLD signal. To add time.sleep(), I guess, make this signal handled already, then it would not call a terminal of a useful process.

BUT, this explanation is mainly a guess, if you find it wrong, let me know. THX! However, time.sleep() is indeed useful for avoiding this error referring to my experience.
